metadata.title: CVE-2018-18347 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of failed navigations with invalid URLs in Navigation inGoogle Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker to trick auser into executing javascript in an arbitrary origin via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
